intro: Astripomoea hyoscyamoides var. hyoscyamoides, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces seeds in spherical capsules. It is a climbing vine that can grow up to several meters in length, often using its tendrils to support itself. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant, though some varieties contain toxic compounds.
